title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: First a telephone HR interview just asking basic questions, then a manager interview that seemed to duplicate the HR interview, then a team panel interview where they again asked a lot of the same questions. I got time to ask them questions but did not feel comfortable asking what I really wanted to know. , They took many months and no communication between steps before offer.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: Information Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with hiring manager, discussed previous resources responsibilities, pay range, general expectations. Overall, a very open and pleasant experience. Position would have not been a good fit for me at the time, but was I’m encouraged to discuss by a former contact on the team who thought it may line up well.
Interview Questions: Familiarity with some of the specific technologies in use.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough. Recruiter was prompt, and had a very detailed timeline of events for the interview. Was made to feel very comfortable. Team was welcoming, met with multiple people throughout the interview and felt like I was asked many questions and had the opportunity to ask questions as well.
Interview Questions: My goals for this role

title: New Grad Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was really well organized. They gave you all the information upfront including benefits and hourly pay. I really appreciated the transparency of the process. They gave offers less than a week after the interview day, so I appreciated the fast turn around time as well.
Interview Questions: Describe an experience in which a patient was declining and you intervened.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: At first, there was a 30-minute interview with a residency recruiter. Several questions were asked regarding career goals, desires, and past. Then an in person interview is set up for a face-to-face meeting to see if it is a good match for the unit.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals?

title: Patient Registration Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy and quick. Skype interview then I was called in for an in person interview. They asked about previous work history and how coworkers would describe me. They described the job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your previous work history

title: EKG Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very informative was a quick process looking forward to my second interview which will be in person so I will update then and see how everything goes wish me luck
Interview Questions: What is one of my weakness?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted to schedule a phone interview with a hiring specialist. During that phone call, I was offered an in person interview a few days later. The in person interview was a hiring event that involved interviewing with managers of different units at the hospital.
Interview Questions: Describe an instance in which you experienced professional conflict and explain how you handled it.

title: Medical Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I received a screen call from HR and then was set up for an in person interview that same week. I received an e-mail offer for the position four days later. Once I accepted I was then set up with an employee health appointment 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: What are my goals for the future, where do I see myself 5 years from now.

title: Caregiver, CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy no complaints. Just like any other job interview. I enjoyed it. Had to have resume . With was no issue. We would work 3 days 16 hour shifts which is good.
Interview Questions:
My availability? 
Days I would like off?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: First I did a Phone interview with a recruiter then a phone interview manager. About 30 minutes each and asked about experience, goals, etc. heard back shortly after and accepted the position immediately upon offer.
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals

title: Healthcare Professional Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: Two step interview process with human resources, and then you interview with the hiring manager and possible the provider you will be working for. After that a decision is made and HR extends the offer.
Interview Questions: How do you provide good customer service?

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interviews are short and followed up by a second depending if you are a potential candidate. Overall an easy process, but definitely recommend having someone from NGHS as a reference.
Interview Questions: What is a weakness you see in your self.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on the website, I was contacted by HR by the phone and was set up with an interview with the department manager. The department interview was in person.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had conflict with a coworker and how did you resolve it?

title: Patient Greeter PRN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Loganville, GA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was straight forward easy to do. All of the questions I asked were answered perfectly. No miscommunication at all. The conversation was sweet I could really see myself moving forward at this job.
Interview Questions: Would I be interested in working flexible hours over time if needed?

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: Very easy! Asked questions about myself, when I could work. Told me more about the role and what I would be doing. Interviewer was very nice and made the process of interviewing very easy!
Interview Questions: What I did and when I would be available

title: Nursing Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Good, interviewers are easy-going. They asked a few situational questions, and they wanted to know their candidates. Make sure you follow the "dress code", they do consider your attitude and apperance seriously.
Interview Questions:
1. Why do you want to be a nurse?
2. Why Northeast?
3. Why this unit?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process takes you through a couple steps but is very well explained. They guide you through the whole process. You first get an email asking you to schedule a phone call with a recruiter. Once you’ve done that they will then schedule an in person interview and send you many emails.
Interview Questions: “Tell me about a time you had to deal with a conflict within one of your coworkers and how you dealt with it”

title: Patient Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Braselton, GA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was asked questions about my previous medical experience and why I wanted to work there. The work would have been mainly transporting patients at all 3 of  the Braselton, Gainesville, and Barrow locations. Some weekends were required.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was extremely nice and professional. I had my interview through Zoom due to Covid but even through video I could tell everyone was excited to meet me. I knew right away I wanted to join the family and become a part of the team.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you are interested in this position.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and to the point.  The questions asked were mostly geared towards patient care and teamwork situations. The interviewer was kind and calm, she didn't make me feel anxious or stressed at all.
Interview Questions: What is one of the most difficult coworker situations you have encountered as an RN and how did you respond?

title: Medical Simulation Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Met individually with several directors. One director explained their vision of the center for the majority of the time. The other director asked more questions; asking about some of the items listed on my resume.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you experienced conflict in the workplace.

title: Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact with recruiter to verify experience, education, and qualifications followed by a panel interview with Case Management dept managers. Offer was extended via telephone call with recruiter approximately 2 weeks later
Interview Questions: How do you feel about death and dying?

title: Food Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back. Women interviewing me were very down to Earth and made me feel right at home. I hope to get the position. They took an interest in me and made sure to show me around and show me what I would be doing
Interview Questions: IF I would be interested in moving to full time.

title: Medical Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the two physicians office, one including the heart center.  I was offered a position within a few days. I really wanted the other one, but excepted the position at the heart center.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress at work?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: Manager was more helpful than the recruiter.  Recruiters have been very late in returning calls (longer than a week).  If you want to get anywhere with HR, I recommend emailing them and CC the manager for the unit you are interviewing for.
Interview Questions: Why am I choosing this organization?

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Thorough. An all day interview with several panels from various disciplines. Great interaction, open dialogue and informative. Insight is provided based on the questions asked. Enjoyed being valued based on skills, knowledge and experience. Enjoyed interviewing with ACNO.
Interview Questions: How do handle criticism/feedback?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then received a call within the next 4 weeks asking for some more information and areas I was specifically interested in. The lady then asked my available dates to come in for an in-person interview at the corporate plaza.  After that interview, they called me back and offered me the job.
Interview Questions: At the in-person interview, they asked me several behavioral questions about what I would do in certain scenarios and why I choose NGHS.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview within a week of application submission. 2 interviews set up with different departments for the following week. After the first interview I was ready to agree to employment. Sent a thank you to the manager for meeting with me and an offer was extended the following day.
Interview Questions: How have you dealt with conflict with a coworker?

title: EVS Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy, didn't take too long like I thought it would. Maybe it was just the person that interviewed me but either way, it wasn't too bad for me.
Interview Questions: Where did you previously work? etc.

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via text message and was able to schedule s phone call to receive more details on position. I then spoke on phone with supervisor and group telephone interview. I am being flown into GA for in person interview
Interview Questions: Why do I want to relocate

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a very quick and easy process.  Once I applied for the position, I was contacted by recruiter who scheduled an interview with the department manager.  It was the myself, the department manager, and the LPN supervisor in the interview.  It was very laid back and comfortable.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position and what are you looking to gain?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Braselton, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Great! Person interviewing was really nice and personable. Questions were pretty cut and dry and relatable. Was pretty clear on what they were looking for and upfront about what they offered and didn't which was a refreshing change from some interviews.
Interview Questions: Why I chose medical assisting?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Dahlonega, GA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I went to a job fair held at a local college and got an interview then and there! The overall interview seemed relaxed yet professional, very future and goal oriented.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you made a mistake.

title: Registration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Oakwood, GA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 3 people (3 different department openings) & asked to describe myself. They had each already reviewed my resume. I went into details about my experiences for the same position at a different facility. They explained what they did & what’s available.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview. Those that make it past phone interviews are selected for an in person interview. It kinda seemed like the extern selection was a "first come first serve" basis. So, if you want this position you should apply early! I did not attend the in person interviews because I had clinical.
Interview Questions: "What do you feel your greatest weakness is so far working as a student nurse?"

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: It took only a week before the interviewing panel of nurse managers in which the questions got more difficult as the interview process went on. It takes a short span for them to get back to you as a candidate
Interview Questions: Clinical experience and practical application

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had basically 3 interviews. I Applied for a medical assistant position over the weekend on the nghs website and was called the next business day by a recruiter (didn't expect a call back so soon but I was excited that I did).  The recruiter did a brief interview over the phone (Maybe 5-7min), and asked questions in regards to education, experience, what type of employment I was looking for (part-time, full-time, prn, etc.),  and where I lived in regards to distance from the medical centers. I was then asked to come in for a face to face interview with the recruiter the following week. At the in person interview (which took about 20min) I spoke with the same recruiter that I spoke with during  the phone interview and I was basically asked the same questions but provided more details and explained what lead me in to wanting a career in the medical field and what my future plans/goals will be. Then I was asked to come to another interview the next day (which took about 10 min, they asked maybe 3-4 simple questions) to meet with 2 other people from the field of practice and facility in which the recruiter thought I'd be a great fit for (this is where the nervousness may come out to play), they basically asked interview questions to see if I will be a good fit for the position and the team. I was then told by the recruiter that I would get a phone call the next day with their decision.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with working for or with a difficult physician?

title: Cerified Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Got a call a week after I filled the application out to come in for an in person interview. I went in and got interviewed by two people. The lab manager and the lab supervisor. They mostly asked me about my previous experiences and how well I’d handle some situations if they ever came up.
Interview Questions: What do I know about the hospital

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Overall easy process....initial phone interview with the HR recruiter....follow up scheduled immediately with the dept manager which included a tour of the hospital & a offer at the end of the day.
Interview Questions: They asked about availability to work & skill level.

title: PRN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I got a call from an HR representative to schedule an interview for the position. I met with the supervisor and another employee in the department.The interview was very laid back and pretty simple. They were very friendly and very nice and I thought it went pretty well. They said they would call by the end of the week with an offer.
Interview Questions: What is a strength you would bring to the job?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, followed by an interview in person; one on one. No panel interview (which I find more personable).  The interview started with a very natural feel and with us just getting to know each other. It allowed me to really get comfortable and be myself. Once I got comfortable, that's when I was asked the interview questions.
Interview Questions: Asked me about my past experience and how I handled a difficult situation with a patient or family member. How I handle workplace difficulties among coworkers. How I manage stress or feeling overwhelmed in the workplace.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Oakwood, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for one interview and promised a second one but was never contacted. Every job I have applied for since then, no matter how qualified I am for the position, they don't even consider me. You have to be related to someone who does the hiring, or be a beautiful tall blonde to get a job here. If you aren't one or the other don't waste your time applying.
Interview Questions: Do I work well with others

title: Resource Pool RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for an internal transfer since I already work for the company. I had a phone interview within a couple of days, then was scheduled a face to face interview with the resource manager within 2 days of that. Interview was informative and relaxing and lasted about 2 hours. I was offered the job the next afternoon.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses? Ugh! Always a hard question!

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Typing test and basic targeted selection interview process. Anyone with the basic understanding of providing complete answers to the interview questions should not have a problem with the interview.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you for this role?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: First you always receive a phone interview. Based off the phone interview you will receive an interview at the hospital or corporate plaza.  If that goes well you are called back and have to once again return to sign paperwork ect.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you used exceptional teamwork

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Put in an application several months before getting a call back - went to recruitment office to do initial interview, then had to meet with Practice Admin for the location. Well, I did not get that position, which I was notified by email about. About 2 months later I was called back and interviewed for another location - which I ended up accepting a position with. After accepting the position I still had to go through a Pre-Employment Physical, Drug screen, TB skin test, and Orientation (which is a 2 day process in an of itself).
Interview Questions: If I was knowledgeable/proficient in phlebotomy

title: Benefits Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions:
I received a call for an interview a few days after submitting my application. I had a phone interview with the recruiter followed by an onsite interview with the recruiter the next day. 

After this, they sent me a skills assessment for Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint. After passing that, I was invited back to interview with the head of HR and the manager of benefits. 

After making the final cut (3 candidates), I was brought in for another onsite with the team. There were roughly 6 people in the room at any given time but others would come in and out.

I was told that I would hear back in a few weeks. After a while of not hearing anything back, I found a generic rejection email in my junk mail.

After four interviews with PTO time taken on each and being a final candidate, I would have expected a bit more than an email to let me know I didn't get the position.
Interview Questions: They asked me how large of a group of people I had ever given an orientation to.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions:
You first interview with HR and if they believe you meet the qualifications they move you on to the second interview with the lab manager and assistant manager.  

They ask basic interview questions such as why did you choose NGHS and what you would do in different scenarios.  They are more looking for a candidate who they feel will be a good, and hardworking employee.  But they also want to make sure you are a good fit with the rest of the employees.  You must be able to work well with others because this is a team environment.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose NGHS?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed by a recruiter telling me to call and set up an interview. I then contacted her and set up an interview for a couple of days later. This was a phone interview. I interviewed with the hiring manager and a charge nurse on the unit. It was very professional and the questions were fair and appropriate. I was given details about the position and also was told when I could expect to hear back. It took a little longer than I was told to hear back from the recruiter regarding if I got hired or not. That was only flaw of the interview - mainly due to my own impatience!
Interview Questions: How do you think you will transition from your current role to working here?

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with nurse recruiter from NEGA for a one on one interview. This was done at another facility. If selected to proceed, continue to meet with several unit managers from floors of your choosing. (up to three). Wait to hear back from nurse recruitment to find out which unit managers gave offers, and accept position of your choice to begin orientation.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work on this particular unit

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Confusing and relaxed. The recruiter was not consistent in providing the information I needed. she was slow to answer my requests. The department interview was not bad. I was interviewed for a Project Manager position however the panel interview seemed confusing because some people showed up late to the panel. I had to do a presentation on leaders I admire or leaders who have shaped my leadership style. This was their version of getting to know me. This was okay as well.
Interview Questions: Standard Interview questions along with behavioral based/team interview questions (how do you work well in a team/handle conflict etc.

title: Medical Instrument Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had to have a license /certificate and a BLS certificate. Show proof of a citizen of United States, I must show proof of skills and training for the position that I was applying for; in addition to have a  High School Diploma/ transcript. This position require for candidates' to summit a screening for a criminal back ground check alone with a drug screening test.
Interview Questions: What make you different from any other candidate.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: First they call you over the phone to set up a phone interview. During the phone interview they basically ask simple questions to find out if you are qualified and still interested. Then they set up a face to face interview with the department manager. This is when you get to ask your own questions and they also find out about your previous experience and so forth. Mine was fairly straightforward.
Interview Questions: What types of surgeries were performed at my previous job? And also how well I work within a team.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a recruiter. Then I was scheduled to interview with the Administrator, DON, and supervisor. Then I was given a tour. The process took a week. I was called a week later by the recruiter with a job offer
Interview Questions: How do you work under stress?

title: Vascular Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied to this Vascular Technologist position in November of 2014 on the NGHS website, which was very simple to use. I received a call from an HR employee (who I will not name) in mid-December requesting to schedule a phone interview in January. She was 45 minutes late for the 'phone interview', which was basically a 3-minute phone call to schedule an actual interview with the Vascular Lab. She said she would email me with the details about the face to face interview. I did receive an email, from a different HR rep, with the director, location and directions to the interview. I am relocating soon to this area, so they knew I had to drive 3.5 hours for this interview. When I arrived at the department, I was told the person I was supposed to interview with was not there that day, and even more that he was from the Echo department, not Vascular which was what I had been told and applied for. So they let me talk to the Vascular supervisor who was very nice but explained that neither department are hiring or have any positions open. I was furious! I called the HR employee but she did not answer her phone. I have left many messages and emails about this issue and none of them have been answered. This whole experience has been extremely unprofessional, I wouldn't accept a job from them.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and was called to schedule an interview the same day.
The interview was very general, she reviewed my experience, set me up for additional testing and told me that I would receive a call later in the afternoon to schedule a follow-up interview with a manager for the Access department. 

I did receive a call later in the afternoon to schedule the next interview.
Interview Questions: The interview was very general, recruiter did not really interview me, she reviewed my experience, se tme up for additional testing and told me that I would receive a call later in the afternoon to schedule a follow-up interview with a manager for the Access department.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: I applied for an RN position on med surg floor and it took about 2 weeks and then I got a call from the HR and an interview was scheduled with the nurse manager. My interview was more of a casual discussion. She asked me where I was currently working and to tell her about myself. She then asked what was my day like. She went on to tell me about the floor and a regular routine on the floor.She asked me a few more questions and then I asked her a couple questions too. Next thing she arranged a side by side shadowing with a nurse. After the shadowing i sent her an email about my experience and i told her i liked it. i got a call from HR 2 days later with an offer.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: CNA/Unit Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter to interview for a CNA position.  The interview was fairly brief and to the point.  I was asked the usual questions such as work experience, hours I can work, why I want to work in healthcare, and customer service oriented questions.  I was asked to come back and interview with a nurse manager, which wasn't scheduled until another two weeks out from my initial interview.  The second interview was short and unorganized.  Again, I was asked the usual questions. I followed up with the recruiter after the second interview and never received a response.  Finally, after another two weeks passed I received an email stating I was not chosen for the position.  The entire process took one month.  I feel that the organization wasted my time.  I would not recommend.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Everything handled through Human Resources.  Multiple people involved-recruiter, HR assistant, Manager of department.  I felt like I got lost in the shuffle.  When I finally got an interview, it went well.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths/weaknesses?

title: Payment Poster Ngpg Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a recruiter (don't want to give names). I have 5 years experience in this position. She made me a offer, I asked for more. She said she would get with the compensation dept and call me monday. Needless to say monday came and went. I called her twice with messages left. No call back. To me this is unprofessional and rude.
Interview Questions: Pretty much she just went over my resume and that was it. She said that she would get back with me monday after she talked to compensation. She wanted to send me over to meet tge directors over the office.

title: Project Leader - Leadership Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was first contacted by a recruiter, then the hiring manager contacted me for an interview. My first phone interview was followed up by a 2 hour personal interview. It was a little weird that the interviewer contacted me directly at first and then did not respond to me when they decided to pass along the offer to another candidate before I had completed my interview process. The feedback I received was that I was better suited for a role that required my leadership abilities.
Interview Questions: Am I familiar with coaching leaders?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. My application was rejected until I was able to get an employee referral. You have to get your application flagged by a current employee for them to even look at your application I guess. Then there was a phone screen and they made me take a typing test I had to pass before I could set up an in person interview.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an equal level co-worker causing problems?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System
Interview Descriptions: The process was easy. Submitted resume and was called the next day. Interviewed with several floors and received 2 offers.
Interview Questions: None

title: CMA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
It was great thank you. It was very thorough and detailed. The staff was very nice. 
The location was comfortable. They made me feel welcome and did not keep me waiting.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths? What are your weaknesses? Describe a difficult situation and how you handled it. What is your biggest accomplishment?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions on lab draw.However, getting hired is contingent on who you know.Interview process is just a formality.There is strict background checking conducted.Please make sure everything on your resume is accurate.
Interview Questions: What is the order of draw?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was already an employee of NGHS and applied for the Patient Access position. I originally interviewed for a different job in the call center and was then sent to two other patient access departments to interview with other managers. The interview was with the Outpatient Registration Manager and Supervisor, and I did not hear back from HR until about 2 weeks later that I was being offered the job.
Interview Questions: If a co-worker was causing problems or drama that you did not want to be a part of, how would you as an equal level co-worker handle the situation?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview and then face to face with an external recruiter.  Once the recruiter decided to present me as a candidate, he met with the hospital leadership and gave them my info.  Then I met with individual leaders and a number of panels.
Interview Questions: Can you do this job

title: Staff Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeast Georgia Health System (Gainesville, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very clear and courteous. I felt like the HR department cared very deeply for the organization. They wanted what was best for their patients. I was shown to what great extents the health system takes to offer the best in clinical services.
Interview Questions: What would you like to accomplish as a professional here? The interview process was very clear and courteous. I felt like the HR department cared very deeply for the organization. They wanted what was best for their patients.
